definition: "to eat" or "food" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 184)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
rice bowl/fig. livelihood/job/way of making a living
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary

sentences.english: Wu Pan chooses or eat green meal.
sentences.chinese: 吴盼选择还是吃青春饭。

sentences.english: The hungry man devoured his dinner.
sentences.chinese: 那饿汉狼吞虎咽地把饭吃光了。

sentences.english: You two treated me many times before when I was looking for a job. Now I’m making good money, so it should be my turn.
sentences.chinese: 以前我在找工作的时候，你们两请我吃过好多次饭。

sentences.english: As soon as this was done, they cooked a meal oven an open fire.
sentences.chinese: 这件事刚做完，他们就在篝火上烧起了饭。

sentences.english: I'll just make a nice risotto .
sentences.chinese: 我会做超好吃的意大利饭。

sentences.english: The patient is much better. She's got an appetite now.
sentences.chinese: 这个病人好多了，饭也吃得下了。

sentences.english: She makes sure he eats well and takes his medications.
sentences.chinese: 她还要确保儿子饭吃得香，并按时服药。

sentences.english: Before each meal my father or mother would say a prayer of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭前父亲或母亲总要作谢饭祷告。

sentences.english: Olive oil is basic to paella.
sentences.chinese: 橄榄油是海鲜饭的基本佐料。

sentences.english: Stir in basil. Spoon curry over rice. Serve.
sentences.chinese: 拌入罗勒叶，把咖喱浇在饭上即可。

sentences.english: The boy threw up his dinner again.
Maybe one day I'll have to beg a meal off you in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 说不定以后我混不下去了到北京还得找你给我口饭吃。

sentences.english: Look, there are lots of rice on you clothes. Let mommy take them off.
sentences.chinese: 看，你的衣服上都是饭，妈妈给你把它们掸下去。

sentences.english: When Han arrived, there is no pot of rice.
sentences.chinese: 当韩信赶来，锅里已经没有饭了。

sentences.english: He was hungry so he decided to be for a meal at the next house.
sentences.chinese: 于是他决定向下一户人家讨口饭吃。

definition: plain cooked rice/rice with nothing to go with it
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
